title: Work-energy theorem - block pulled across tabletop

content.question: A <math alttext="0.2 kilogram" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>0.2</mn><mo> </mo><mi>kg</mi></math> block is initially at rest on a rough, horizontal tabletop. A student then pulls the block across the tabletop with a constant horizontal force of <math alttext="0.75 newton" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>0.75</mn><mo> </mo><mi mathvariant="normal">N</mi></math>. After being pulled a distance of <math alttext="2 meters" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn><mo> </mo><mi mathvariant="normal">m</mi></math>, the speed of the block is <math alttext="3 meters per second" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>3</mn><mo> </mo><mtext>m</mtext><mo>/</mo><mtext>s</mtext></math>. The amount of energy dissipated by friction between the block and the tabletop is most nearly

skill.text: 2.B: Calculate or estimate an unknown quantity with units from known quantities, by selecting and following a logical computational pathway.
